reviewText: If God has a plan for your life, for my life and for all life... then do we believe it.This is a strong film showing a young man trying to find his birth mother, a woman trying to seek the hole for the son she didn't have, and a young girl struggling with the thought of being pregnant and what she should do.Some folks will fight this film.  Primarily saying it is religious propaganda. And honestly... it is. and it is MEANT TO BE!Abortion is a pain that hurts not only the child, but ultimately the mother and the family.This film may not be for all, but it will help you to think.When you can see a heart beat as early as 8 weeks, is it still just a blob or a baby that is meant to have life?This film will touch your heart... it is up to God as to how that will effect you.
summary: Is all Life Meant to BE?
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a touching but sad fantasy about a young man on a quest to find his birth mother. The story captures the imagination of the viewer and introduces occasional mysterious touches which are explained at the end of the film.It has a powerful message which will likely polarize those who watch; some will heartily agree while others will strongly disagree on the validity of the message.One might say the film is a celebration of life; all life, regardless of status has a value and a place and deserves an opportunity to express the potential contained in that life. While the film may leave some questions unanswered, it does address the major premise of the film with clarity; life deserves a chance.The acting is generally effective and convincing and developed in me a concern for the characters; I felt involved in their hopes and fears and sympathetic to their situations.This is not light entertainment but worthwhile viewing if one loves life.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have some mixed feelings about this flick. It was written by friends of mine and I really wanted to think this was a must see movie. The message was one that needs to be brought to the world.  Young girls need to be made aware of the ramifications for their future when they opt to go through an abortion. And Christians who fight tooth and claw against abortion need to be ready to help candidates for an abortion deal with an unwanted pregnancy through love and caring instead of judgmentalism. You know the axiom: hate the sin but love the sinner. The complaint I had about this movie was some skewed realism - which I can't discuss in detail without spoiling the ending of this movie. You might have zippo problem accepting this approach. I'm just too bogged down in pragmatism to accept this without mentioning that this story used a gimmick that some people might think is cool and mysterious, but it messed with my mind. If you're in the group who accepts the gimmick (like the Dove reviewer), you might love this flick. I just liked it, but I promise you I'll never forget it.

reviewText: If you are looking for a movie that pushes a specific ideology then this is the movie for you.  It winds up that this movie was nothingmore than a long anti abortion commercial.  The movie was designed to shame any woman for the choice she made.  The writers decided that they should let women know that whether the woman knows it or not she will never get over the abortion she decided to have.  It was designed in a way to show women that they really aren't smart enough to know what is best for them.  They make the assumption that all women are the same and that they will regret their choice and be plagued with it all their days.  The movie shows how a group of people think that they should have the right to make choices for you.  I started noticing how often the wife was basically dismissed of her feelings of her past choices and then to have her husband say get over it was just it.I will be sure and not watch anything else that comes out of Pure Flix Ent.I feel like I was duped into watching this movie.And please do not feel that you need to respond with your thoughts on abortion.
summary: Nothing more than a really long commercial

reviewText: Dean Cain is great but this movie leads you through a lot of strange twists and turns until you find out what it is really about at the end.  It will be awhile before we watch it again.  It would be great for teenagers who aren't thinking too clearly about where their life is leading them or the unwed mother who is facing a lot of decisions.

reviewText: This movie attempts to present the lives of people who have been aborted but with the twist as if they had not been.  One guy has lost his job, has no registered identity records with government agencies and the only people that can really see or interact with him have been aborted or "angels" who help these people transition into "heaven".  The twist is that most of these people don't learn of this until the film is coming to an end.  There is one case of a lady who did have and abortion, and now tries to make up for it by helping another young person in making the decision of making a mistake (having an abortion).  I don't recommend it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It is Biblical fiction!!!  No matter how good the intent, the movie is just plain wrong according to the Bible.I know the movie was intended to be pro-life, but please base it on true theology, not false popular trash.  The Bible says, "The dead know not anything",  They do not lead an invisible life in this world.  The Bible NEVER speaks of immortality of the soul.  Immortality is used only in reference to God alone.The acting, script pace, and content was poorly put together.  The continuity of the film seemed unrelated with many scenes used only as unnecessary fille.  There were no scenes of violence, crime, and solicitous sex, but that still does not make it a good movie.DON'T BUY IT!!
